intro: Gouania urticifolia, commonly known as stinging nettle tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its stinging hairs on its leaves, which can cause irritation upon contact. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic in shape, and often have a serrated margin. The flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, producing a capsule fruit that contains numerous seeds.
